Class PathfindingManager

java.lang.Object
gamePackages.toolsManager.PathfindingManager
public class PathfindingManager extends Object
Manages pathfinding using a grid-based system. The `PathfindingManager` class is responsible for managing nodes, calculating paths, and updating pathfinding maps for entities in the game world.

  • Constructor Details

    • PathfindingManager

      public PathfindingManager(List<List<Integer>> PathfindingMap)
      Constructs a `PathfindingManager` with the given pathfinding map.
      Parameters:
      PathfindingMap - A 2D list of integers representing the pathfinding map.

  • Method Details

    • setPathMap

      public void setPathMap()
      Initializes the pathfinding grid and sets up default start and goal nodes.

    • updatePathMap

      public void updatePathMap(Entity entitySource, Entity entityTarget, List<com.badlogic.gdx.math.Rectangle> walls)
      Updates the pathfinding map based on the positions of the source and target entities, and the walls.
      Parameters:
      entitySource - The source entity.
      entityTarget - The target entity.
      walls - A list of rectangles representing walls in the map.

    • getNode

      public Node[][] getNode()
      Gets the grid of nodes.
      Returns:
      A 2D array of `Node` objects representing the grid.

    • displayPathMap

      public void displayPathMap()
      Displays the current pathfinding map in the console. This method prints the pathfinding map to the console for debugging purposes.

    • search

      public void search(Entity entitySource, Entity entityTarget, List<com.badlogic.gdx.math.Rectangle> walls)
      Performs the A* pathfinding algorithm to find the shortest path.
      Parameters:
      entitySource - The source entity (starting point).
      entityTarget - The target entity (ending point).
      walls - A list of rectangles representing obstacles. This method executes the A* algorithm to determine the shortest path between `entitySource` and `entityTarget`. It uses an open list to track nodes to be explored and a closed list for nodes that have already been processed. The path is determined when the goal node is reached.

    • getMaxCol

      public int getMaxCol()
      Returns the maximum number of columns in the pathfinding grid.
      Returns:
      The number of columns.

    • getMaxRow

      public int getMaxRow()
      Returns the maximum number of rows in the pathfinding grid.
      Returns:
      The number of rows.

    • getPathMap

      public List<List<Integer>> getPathMap()
      Returns the pathfinding map as a 2D list.
      Returns:
      A 2D list representing the pathfinding map.

    • getClosedList

      public List<Node> getClosedList()
      Returns the list of closed nodes.
      Returns:
      A list of explored (closed) nodes.
